screens.title: Arrays: Your Digital Shopping List üõí
screens.analogy: Think of an array like a shopping list. It stores multiple items in order, and each item has a position number (called an index). Just like how the first item on your list is at position 1, the first item in an array is at position 0.
screens.tip: Computers count from 0, not 1! The first item is at index 0, second at index 1, and so on.

screens.title: Test Your Knowledge
screens.question: What does pets[1] return?
